alert.note: Alert for Gallatin; Madison (Montana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 16 at 4:58PM MDT by NWS GreatFalls
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern Madison and west central Gallatin Counties through 530 PM MDT... At 456 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 15 miles southeast of Harrison, or 22 miles west of Bozeman, moving east at 10 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph, penny size hail, and heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Roads will likely become slick with ponding of water, and localized minor flooding of low lying areas is possible. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of northeastern Madison and west central Gallatin Counties. This includes Highway 191 near mile marker 70. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
